Package algorithms.imageProcessing

Class FFT

java.lang.Object
algorithms.imageProcessing.FFT
public class FFT extends Object
adapted from Cormen, Leiserson, Rivest, and Stein pseudocode first implemented in project https://github.com/nking/curvature-scale-space-corners-and-transformations w/ Copyright (c) 2014 Climb With Your Feet and using The MIT License (MIT) then moved to this shared library project which has the same copyright and license.
Author:
nichole

    • setToNotNormalize

      public void setToNotNormalize()

    • fft

      public Complex[] fft(Complex[] x)
      compute the FFT of x[], assuming its length is a power of 2. runtime complexity is O(N*log(N)). (adapted from Cormen, Leiserson, Rivest, and Stein pseudocode) ability added
      Parameters:
      x -
      Returns:

    • fft

      protected Complex[] fft(Complex[] x, boolean forward)
      FFT from Cormen, Leiserson, Rivest, and Stein pseudocode for iterative FFT w/ an inverse ability added. Note that the length of x must be a power of 2. runtime complexity is O(N*log(N)).
      Parameters:
      x -
      forward - run the transform in forward if true, else perform inverse transform.
      Returns:

    • ifft

      public Complex[] ifft(Complex[] x)
      compute the inverse FFT of x[], assuming its length is a power of 2 runtime complexity is O(N). (adapted from Cormen, Leiserson, Rivest, and Stein pseudocode for forward transform)
      Parameters:
      x -
      Returns:

    • fft

      public double[] fft(int[] x)
      perform FFT on x runtime complexity is O(N*log(N)). (adapted from Cormen, Leiserson, Rivest, and Stein pseudocode for forward transform). Note that the result cannot be inverted because only the real portion is returned and inverse FFT needs the real and complex components.
      Parameters:
      x -
      Returns:

    • fft

      public double[] fft(double[] x)
      perform FFT on x runtime complexity is O(N). (adapted from Cormen, Leiserson, Rivest, and Stein pseudocode for forward transform). Note that the result cannot be inverted because only the real portion is returned and inverse FFT needs the real and complex components.
      Parameters:
      x -
      Returns:
